fields.customfield_10701:
URL can be accessed by the SNAP survey

On accessing the URL, domain 2 will be updated to Complete and Met and will display as Met in the PQS task list

MYS will assign the domain points when setting the domain to Met

closedSprints.name: PQS 2.0
closedSprints.goal: To smash the PQS into the back of the net

comments.body:
Please refer to story: [https://bsa2468.atlassian.net/browse/BP275-2655?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiYzU3OWExYWY2ZDAyNDExZTlhODVhYjhiOWIyMzhjYjMiLCJwIjoiaiJ9|https://bsa2468.atlassian.net/browse/BP275-2655?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiYzU3OWExYWY2ZDAyNDExZTlhODVhYjhiOWIyMzhjYjMiLCJwIjoiaiJ9|smart-link] 



Branch: features/bp275-2655-quality-domain-2-audits-link-to-snap-survey

Test Survey has been completed on localhost and it appears to work. Status changes to MET in PQS and domain points also update.



Will wait for the final survey before this gets moved to Done.

When testing this in test we are unable to submit the survey and see the status change. Have spoken to [~accountid:5ae0572d58742e214dd024a2] who says this is expected due to the way the survey is set up on dev/test environments - it links back to localhost when submitting.

Testing on localhost works as expected and the status changes as well as the domain points.

URL has been updated to point to the test environment as opposed to localhost. I have manually tested this by completing the survey. When pressing the submit button the user is taken back to the PQS checklist and then domain status and points are updated to the complete stage. Can also see this in the database as well.

fields.description:
As a contractor

I need to be able to register for the Hep C service via MYS

So that i can notify NHSEI of my intention to provide the service

||

prototype||[https://mys-admin.herokuapp.com/newdesign/advanced/hep-c-start-reg|https://mys-admin.herokuapp.com/newdesign/advanced/hep-c-start-reg]||
||url||register-for-service||
||title||Register to provide this service||
||section||Community Pharmacy Hepatitis C Antibody Testing Service||
||Header||Register to provide this service||
||Info||By registering to provide this service you are confirming that:
* you want to provide the Community Pharmacy Hepatitis C Antibody Testing Service (Advanced Service) from your pharmacy
* you have read the service specification and will be able to comply with its requirements when providing the service||
||Q1||Do you want to register for this service?||
||Content||Yes / No||
||Error messages||*Select yes if you want to register to provide the service*||



*Routing*

if “Yes”>>> registraton declaration page

if “No”>>> back to dashboard

fields.description:
||From||Manage Your Service||
||To||email address||
||Subject||Registration for the Community pharmacy Hepatitis C Antibody Testing Service||

Dear ((firstName)) ((surname)),

You’ve registered for the +_Community Pharmacy Hepatitis C Antibody Testing Service_+

Your registration details

Your registration details are:
Pharmacy Name: ((pharmacyName))
Pharmacy (ODS) code: ((dispCode))
Pharmacy address: ((pharmacyAddress))
Registered email address: ((emailAddress))
Optional email address: ((optionalEmailAddress))

Your declaration was completed on ((declarationDate)) by ((firstName)) ((surname)).

What happens next
If your details are correct you do not need to do anything else.
If any details are incorrect or you have not registered for this service, contact us on [nhsbsa.mys@nhs.net|mailto:nhsbsa.mys@nhs.net]
We will aim to reply within two working days.

Regards,

NHS Business Services Authority (NHSBSA) Team
[www.nhsbsa.nhs.uk/PrescriptionServices.aspx|http://www.nhsbsa.nhs.uk/PrescriptionServices.aspx]

Use our online Ask Us service to find answers to your questions 24/7.

Please read our email disclaimer online at: [http://www.nhsbsa.nhs.uk/email|http://www.nhsbsa.nhs.uk/email]

To reduce our environmental footprint, please only print when necessary.

We will aim to reply within two working days.

Regards,

NHS Business Services Authority (NHSBSA) Team

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: Work in progress

fields.description:
Report required on registrations which contains the following

* registration date
* ODS code
* Pharmacy name
* Pharmacy address

MDT feature to be able to download the report as and when req?
customfield_10007: com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint@6e0a9a54[id=1631,rapidViewId=170,state=ACTIVE,name=Valentines Eve Massacre <s3,goal=To save the nation from Hepatitis C,startDate=2020-01-30T12:06:06.910Z,endDate=2020-02-13T08:44:00.000Z,completeDate=<null>,sequence=1134]

nonEditableReason.message: Portfolio for Jira must be licensed for the Parent Link to be available.

comments.body:
[~accountid:5a33f1fdb33c21395faead61] [~accountid:557058:3233422a-34aa-4391-8a54-141d331aafd3] [~accountid:557058:6daa794d-c694-4715-a18a-2b7045f1ad4b] Name and address will cause a performance issue as it would need to be pulled from COD for each and every line of the report, as discussed earlier. We also mentioned a potential workaround, to store name and address into a registration table of the database (unnecessarily) at the moment of registration, just for the purpose of this report. This detail in theory can also be outdated by the time the report is generated. 

Did we come to some conclusion how to approach this?

[~accountid:5a33f1fdb33c21395faead61] What details should the address contain? In db we have four address lines and postcode.  Do these need to go into a single column?

Does the report need to be for all registrations or for a given date range?

[~accountid:5ae0572d58742e214dd024a2] there are already instances of COD being used in such a way where it is called whenever a new report line is generated, you can check out an example in the .\\px-returns\\px-returns-mdt\\src\\main\\java\\uk\\nhs\\nhsbsa\\prescriptions\\pxreturns\\mdt\\service\\CpcsRegistrationsReportService.java class in MDT. In particular, the {{buildRow}} method which is executed for each line of the report (each iteration includes a call to the COD’s {{organisationApiClientService.findByAltCode(userRegistration.getDispCode());}} method)

Hi [~accountid:557058:6daa794d-c694-4715-a18a-2b7045f1ad4b] - the problem is that we get 504 gateway timeouts on many of those reports.

[~accountid:5ae0572d58742e214dd024a2] given the timescales for this my recommendation was to save the name and address at the time of registration.  I think that's valid for a registration report i.e. the registration was for that pharmacy with that address at that time - only issue is the amount of duplicated data but again for a registration report, we only expect one per pharmacy.

[~accountid:5ae0572d58742e214dd024a2] i have asked the question on the details of the report contents and will update the ticket when i know more mate.  

We just need to provide them with a report of all registrations. If the users need to filter by date range they can do this themselves from the report we give them.

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.

sprint.name: Valentines Eve Massacre <s3
sprint.goal: To save the nation from Hepatitis C

fields.description:
We are seeing frequent requests from users to ‘unlock’ their NSAID audit because they completed it before intended.

Currently this requires a live database change to clear the audit end date, and this is being done by one developer on the team.  There’s a good chance that there will be a higher number of these requests in the final week of the NSAID audit period, when that developer is on leave and out of the country 😃 

So a simple ‘Unlock NSAID audit’ feature with a search by dispenser code, and an ‘are you sure’ to clear the date, would be useful.

fields.description:
Patient details collection

* ods code
* pharmacy name
* date of consultation
* Approx age - 18-25 / 26-35 / 36-45 etc
* Gender of patient
* CPCS referral
* Type of upper respiratory tract infection
** middle ear
** sore throat
** common cold
** sinusitis
** cough
* OTC medicine recommended? Y/N
* Referred to pharmacist? Y/N/NA
* Advised to see GP other service?
* Written information provided?

fields.description:
No minimum requirement - but expected to see a minimum of 10

no guarantee that patients will present with any condition that would include them in the audit, there will therefore need functionality for them to record they did the audit but not enter any data (or enter zeroes as their return result).

closedSprints.name: PQS 2.0
closedSprints.goal: To smash the PQS into the back of the net

comments.body:
Create PQS email template in Gov.notify - done

Updates to the production MDT and MYS properties files - merge request created ready for release - done
Set up new gateway questions and plans

Checked the gateway mappings table

Set the quality payments period in MDT

Updated PCN data will be available on 30 or 31 January
Load the latest gateway checks information into MDT - done
archive the aspirational PQS data from last year - done
Load the digital enablers checks into the database - done

sprint.name: Valentines Eve Massacre <s3
sprint.goal: To save the nation from Hepatitis C

fields.description:
*Page:* Pharmacy Reports
*URL:* [https://tst.services.nhsbsa.nhs.uk/nhs-prescription-services-submissions/YP12345/pharmacy-reports/step-1-find-pharmacy|https://tst.services.nhsbsa.nhs.uk/nhs-prescription-services-submissions/YP12345/pharmacy-reports/step-1-find-pharmacy]

On the pharmacy reports page, there is a default value on the text field, this means that on click of the text field the default text ("Please select an option") remains present in the field. This is awkward when using a screenreader as the field is already populated with a default message.

The default value could be removed by a placeholder text of the same value.
